t: Mark 12
The Parable of the Wicked Vinedressers

Then*p He began to speak to them in parables: “A*r man*r planted*r a*r vineyard*r and*r set*r a*r hedge*r around*r it,*ir dug*r a*ir place*ir for*ir the*r wine*r vat*r and*r built*r a*r tower.*r And*r he*r leased*r it*r to*r vinedressers*r and*r went*r into*r a*r far*r country.*r
Now*r at*r vintage-time*r he*r sent*r a*r servant*r to*r the*r vinedressers,*r that*r he*r might*r receive*r some*r of*r the*r fruit*r of*r the*r vineyard*r from*r the*r vinedressers.*r
And*r they*r took*r him*ir and*r beat*r him*r and*r sent*r him*ir away*r empty-handed.*r
Again*r he*r sent*r them*r another*r servant,*r and*r at*r him*r they*r threw*r stones,*r wounded*r him*ir in*r the*r head,*r and*r sent*r him*ir away*r shamefully*r treated.*r
And*r again*r he*r sent*r another,*r and*r him*r they*r killed;*r and*r many*r others,*r beating*r some*r and*r killing*r some.*r
Therefore*r still*r having*r one*r son,*r his*r beloved,*r he*r also*r sent*r him*r to*r them*r last,*r saying,*r ‘They*r will*r respect*r my*r son.’*r
But*r those*r vinedressers*r said*r among*r themselves,*r ‘This*r is*r the*r heir.*r Come,*r let*r us*r kill*r him,*r and*r the*r inheritance*r will*r be*r ours.’*r
So*r they*r took*r him*r and*r killed*r him*ir and*r cast*r him*ir out*r of*r the*r vineyard.*r
“Therefore*rp what*r will*r the*r owner*r of*r the*r vineyard*r do?*r He*r will*r come*r and*r destroy*r the*r vinedressers,*r and*r give*r the*r vineyard*r to*r others.*r
Have you not even read this Scripture: ‘The*rpn stone*r which*r the*r builders*r rejected*r Has*rld become*r the*r chief*r cornerstone.*r
This*rld was*r the*r Lord’s*sb doing,*r And*rld it*r is*r marvelous*r in*r our*r eyes’?”*r
And*p they sought to lay hands on Him, but feared the multitude, for they knew He had spoken the parable against them. So they left Him and went away.
The Pharisees: Is It Lawful to Pay Taxes to Caesar?
Then*p they sent to Him some of the Pharisees and the Herodians, to catch Him in His*i words.

When they had come, they said to Him, “Teacher, we know that You are true, and care about no one; for You do not regard the person of men, but teach the way of God in truth. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?
Shall we pay, or shall we not pay?” But*p He, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, “Why*r do*r you*r test*r Me?*r Bring*r Me*r a*r denarius*r that*r I*r may*r see*r it.”*ir
So they brought it.*i And*p He said to them, “Whose*r image*r and*r inscription*r is*ir this?”*r They said to Him, “Caesar’s.”
And*p Jesus answered and said to them, “Render*r to*r Caesar*r the*r things*r that*r are*r Caesar’s,*r and*r to*r God*r the*r things*r that*r are*r God’s.”*r And*p they marveled at Him.
The Sadducees: What About the Resurrection?
Then*p some*i Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Him; and they asked Him, saying:
“Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man’s brother dies, and leaves his*i wife behind, and leaves no children, his brother should take his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.
Now there were seven brothers. The first took a wife; and dying, he left no offspring.
And the second took her, and he died; nor did he leave any offspring. And the third likewise.
So the seven had her and left no offspring. Last of all the woman died also.
Therefore, in the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be? For all seven had her as wife.”
Jesus*p answered and said to them, “Are*r you*r not*r therefore*r mistaken,*r because*r you*r do*r not*r know*r the*r Scriptures*r nor*r the*r power*r of*r God?*r
For*r when*r they*r rise*r from*r the*r dead,*r they*r neither*r marry*r nor*r are*r given*r in*r marriage,*r but*r are*r like*r angels*r in*r heaven.*r

But*r concerning*r the*r dead,*r that*r they*r rise,*r have*r you*r not*r read*r in*r the*r book*r of*r Moses,*r in*r the*r burning*ir bush*r passage,*ir how*r God*r spoke*r to*r him,*r saying,*r ‘I*r am*ir the*r God*r of*r Abraham,*r the*r God*r of*r Isaac,*r and*r the*r God*r of*r Jacob’?*r
He*r is*r not*r the*r God*r of*r the*r dead,*r but*r the*r God*r of*r the*r living.*r You*r are*r therefore*r greatly*r mistaken.”*r
The Scribes: Which Is the First Commandment of All?
Then*p one of the scribes came, and having heard them reasoning together, perceiving that He had answered them well, asked Him, “Which is the first commandment of all?”
Jesus*p answered him, “The*r first*r of*r all*r the*r commandments*r is:*ir ‘Hear,*r O*r Israel,*r the*r Lord*sbr our*r God,*r the*r Lord*sbr is*r one.*r

And*r you*r shall*r love*r the*r Lord*sr your*r God*r with*r all*r your*r heart,*r with*r all*r your*r soul,*r with*r all*r your*r mind,*r and*r with*r all*r your*r strength.’*r This*r is*ir the*r first*r commandment.*r
And*r the*r second,*r like*r it,*ir is*ir this:*r ‘You*r shall*r love*r your*r neighbor*r as*r yourself.’*r There*r is*r no*r other*r commandment*r greater*r than*r these.”*r
So*p the scribe said to Him, “Well said,*i Teacher. You have spoken the truth, for there is one God, and there is no other but He.

And to love Him with all the heart, with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love one’s neighbor as oneself, is more than all the whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
Now*p when Jesus saw that he answered wisely, He said to him, “You*r are*r not*r far*r from*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r But*p after that no one dared question Him.
Jesus: How Can David Call His Descendant Lord?
Then*p Jesus answered and said, while He taught in the temple, “How*r is*ir it*ir that*r the*r scribes*r say*r that*r the*r Christ*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r David?*r
For*r David*r himself*r said*r by*r the*r Holy*r Spirit:*r ‘The*rpn Lord*sb said*r to*r my*r Lord,*r “Sit*rld at*r My*r right*r hand,*r Till*rld I*r make*r Your*r enemies*r Your*r footstool.”’*r
Therefore*rp David*r himself*r calls*r Him*r ‘Lord’;*r how*r is*r He*r then*ir his*r Son?”*r And*p the common people heard Him gladly.
Beware of the Scribes
Then*p He said to them in His teaching, “Beware*r of*r the*r scribes,*r who*r desire*r to*r go*r around*r in*r long*r robes,*r love*ir greetings*r in*r the*r marketplaces,*r
the*r best*r seats*r in*r the*r synagogues,*r and*r the*r best*r places*r at*r feasts,*r
who*r devour*r widows’*r houses,*r and*r for*r a*r pretense*r make*r long*r prayers.*r These*r will*r receive*r greater*r condemnation.”*r
The Widow’s Two Mites
Now*p Jesus sat opposite the treasury and saw how the people put money into the treasury. And many who*i were*i rich put in much.
Then one poor widow came and threw in two mites, which make a quadrans.

So He called His disciples to Himself*i and said to them, “Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r this*r poor*r widow*r has*r put*r in*r more*r than*r all*r those*r who*r have*r given*r to*r the*r treasury;*r
for*r they*r all*r put*r in*r out*r of*r their*r abundance,*r but*r she*r out*r of*r her*r poverty*r put*r in*r all*r that*r she*r had,*r her*r whole*r livelihood.”*r
